intro: Tieghemopanax suborbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular palaquium, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, orbicular-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
